phrases.answer: I’m doing well, thank you! How about you?
Nice to meet you too!
Pretty good, just keeping busy.
I’m from India, but I live abroad now.

phrases.english: How long have you been here?
phrases.answer: I’ve been here for about two years.

phrases.english: What do you do for a living?
phrases.answer: I work as a teacher.
Yes, I like to visit this place on weekends.

phrases.english: It’s great to see you again!
phrases.answer: Yes, it’s been a while since we last met.
I think so, maybe at a friend’s party.

phrases.english: Take care and have a good day!
phrases.answer: Thanks! You too, see you soon.

phrases.english: What time do you wake up?
phrases.answer: I usually wake up around 7 AM.

phrases.english: Do you have breakfast at home?
phrases.answer: Yes, I prefer a light breakfast at home.

phrases.english: How do you get to work?
phrases.answer: I usually take the bus.

phrases.english: What time do you start work?
phrases.answer: I start at 9 in the morning.

phrases.english: Do you take a lunch break?
phrases.answer: Yes, I usually have lunch around 1 PM.

phrases.english: What do you do after work?
phrases.answer: I go for a walk or sometimes watch a show.
Yes, I enjoy cooking simple meals.

phrases.english: How do you relax in the evening?
phrases.answer: I listen to music or read a book.

phrases.english: When do you go to bed?
phrases.answer: Usually around 10 or 11 PM.
Yes, I’ll keep a bottle with me.

phrases.english: What kind of work do you do?
phrases.answer: I work in marketing.
Yes, I find it interesting and challenging.
I use a planner and make daily to-do lists.
Yes, I’m learning Spanish online.
Yes, three days a week.
Thanks! I thought it might work well.

phrases.english: Can you help me with this?
phrases.answer: Of course, show me what you need.

phrases.english: I’m a bit tired of meetings today.
phrases.answer: I know, they can be exhausting sometimes.
Sure, that sounds like a good plan.
Thank you! I appreciate the motivation.

phrases.english: Where are you planning to go this weekend?
phrases.answer: I might visit the beach with some friends.
Yes, I went to Thailand last year.

phrases.english: How do I get to the nearest station?
phrases.answer: Go straight and turn right at the traffic light.

phrases.english: Do you like traveling by train?
phrases.answer: Yes, it’s comfortable and scenic.
It was amazing! I went hiking in the hills.
Thanks for reminding me!
About five hours from here.

phrases.english: Is this the right way to the museum?
phrases.answer: Yes, just keep walking for five more minutes.
Yes, I love long drives and good music.
It really is! I could stay here all day.
I really love pasta.
A little spice is fine, but not too much.
I agree! The chef did a great job.

phrases.english: Would you like something to drink?
phrases.answer: Yes, a glass of water please.

phrases.english: Do you prefer tea or coffee?
phrases.answer: I usually drink coffee in the morning.

phrases.english: Can we get the bill, please?
phrases.answer: Sure, I’ll bring it right away.
I know, I’m just really hungry.
Yes, I try to cook at least four times a week.

phrases.english: The restaurant is quite busy tonight!
phrases.answer: Yes, it must be the weekend crowd.
Me too, that was a lot of food.
It’s about thirty dollars.
Yes, we accept all major cards.

phrases.english: Is there a discount on this item?
phrases.answer: Yes, it’s 20% off today.
Yes, it looks great on you.
It’s right next to the entrance.
Of course, the fitting room is over there.
It’s high quality, so it’s worth the price.
Alright, please hand it to the cashier.
No, I have my own, thanks.
Yes, I couldn’t resist buying it.
Yes, I have one brother and one sister.

phrases.english: How often do you visit your parents?
phrases.answer: I try to visit them once a month.
Thank you! They’re growing up fast.

phrases.english: How long have you been married?
phrases.answer: It’s been five wonderful years.

phrases.english: Do you live with your family?
phrases.answer: Yes, we live together in a small apartment.
Yes, we’ve known each other since college.
Yes, I have a cat named Coco.
Yes, I do, especially during holidays.
Thanks, I just wanted to help.
Absolutely, nothing is more important.
Yes, I go jogging every morning.
I’m feeling much better, thank you.
You’re right, it helps prevent stiffness.

phrases.english: Do you follow a diet plan?
phrases.answer: Not really, I just try to eat healthy.

phrases.english: How often do you go to the gym?
phrases.answer: About three times a week.
Thank you! I’ve been working out recently.

phrases.english: Did you get enough sleep last night?
phrases.answer: Not really, I stayed up a bit late.
I will, thanks for the reminder.
Yes, just a little tired from work.

phrases.english: Take a deep breath and relax!
phrases.answer: Good advice, I’ll do that.

phrases.english: What do you think about this movie?
phrases.answer: It was interesting but a bit too long.

phrases.english: How do you feel about the news?
phrases.answer: Honestly, it was quite shocking.
Thanks! I appreciate your support.

phrases.english: You seem a bit down today.
phrases.answer: Yeah, I’m just a little stressed out.
I know, I can’t believe it happened!
Spending time with good friends does.
Glad to hear that! We think alike.
Haha, I couldn’t stop laughing either.
Thank you! That means a lot.
Me neither! What a surprise.

phrases.english: What are your plans for the weekend?
phrases.answer: I might go hiking if the weather is nice.
Not yet, I might just relax at home.
Yes, I’d like to start my own business one day.

phrases.english: Where do you see yourself in five years?
phrases.answer: Hopefully in a stable job that I enjoy.
Sure, let’s plan something for next week.

phrases.english: Don’t worry, everything will be fine.
phrases.answer: Thanks, I really needed to hear that.
Yes, after 7 PM I’ll be available.

phrases.english: I hope you achieve your dreams!
phrases.answer: Thank you! I’ll do my best.
Yes, I feel positive about it.
Absolutely! I’m ready for it.
